bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, July 30, 1896

div1.p: Lazear discusses the upcoming American presidential election.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, July 30, 1896
div1.p:
A letter came
from you on Tuesday
I was wondering what
had became of you
as I had no not
heard for two weeks
nearly.

I was glad to
hear about the people
at Hatley. Amusing
about your check
I would like to read
the Sunday Times very
much if you will
be good enough to send
it. I see the San
Francisco papers every
other day but they
are not very good.

The whole business
at the Chicago
Convention was
rediculous. I am going
to vote for McKinley,
Even out here
nearly all the decent people
are against silver. I feel
sure that Bryan will be badly
beaten.

There has been no change in the life
here. Yesterday I was in the
mountain all day hunting deer.
It is very laborious business
breaking through underbrush and
the deer usually get away
without giving you a shot at
them. I am getting well hardened
and sunburned. I enclose a
letter which has already travelled
considerably.
div1.closer:
Your affectionate Son. Address
LIERLY. RANCH
